News: satellite images reveal the advance

Hello Friends This news is about satellite images reveal the advance

. I will share with you all the details about satellite images reveal the advance

. I have explained the current developments about satellite images reveal the advance

item by item below. Here are the details.



A new Russian military convoy has been spotted thanks to satellite images, but this time the city in focus is Kharkiv (the second largest in Ukraine), and no longer Kiev. According to the images collected and analyzed by Maxar Technologies, relating to April 8, the queue of military vehicles would be 12.8 kilometers long and would be moving south, through the town of Velkyi Burluk, in eastern Ukraine.

MORE INFORMATION

The images show a convoy made up of ‚Äúarmed vehicles, trucks with artillery trailers and support equipment,‚Äù explains Maxar. A much smaller group than the one spotted at the beginning of the invasion, located outside the capital and instead 60 km long.

Dead Russian general, Alexander Bespalov is the ninth colonel to fall in Ukraine. Kiev: more than 19,000 soldiers lost by Putin

‚ÄúThe Russians stole Pope Wojtyla‚Äôs chalice‚Äù: ransacked a seminary in Ukraine

The moves of the Russian army

As reported in the morning by the general staff, Russian troops tried to break through the defenses of the Ukrainian armed forces near Izyum, in the Kharkov region, and to establish control over Mariupol. And the President‚Äôs Office said the Russian offensive in eastern Ukraine had already begun.

Over 3 replies and quotes not shown

If this is the same convoy, it was spotted Apr 8, and could have taken repeated hits. Remember, Ukraine doesn't have any real front lines. 2,000 does seem high, but not impossible, especially if there were troop trucks carrying large numbers.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by DailyMail: These chilling satellite images show hundreds of Russian armoured vehicles heading for a major confrontation with Ukrainian troops which could decide the outcome of the war. The grainy pictures show a column of trucks, some towing artillery, stretching for more than eight miles through Russian-held territory. The article goes on to state the following: The convoy is heading towards eastern Ukraine where decisive battles are expected.

Having failed to capture any major cities, the Kremlin is sending tens of thousands of Russian troops to the Luhansk and Donetsk regions, known as the Donbas.

Satellite imagery firm Maxar Technologies released images this weekend, showing the Russian convoy traveling through the town of Velykyi Burluk, near the city of Kharkiv, on Friday.

The convoy has been described as about 8 miles long.

NEW: Russia is sending an 8-mi long convoy of 100s of vehicles, including armored vehicles and artillery southbound through the Ukrainian town of Velykyi Burluk. The convoy is moving about 60 mi east of Ukraine‚Äôs 2nd-largest city of Kharkiv, as üá∑üá∫ focuses on Donbas. üì∑:@Maxar pic.twitter.com/4EJRHSQZvk ‚Äî Jack Detsch (@JackDetsch) April 10, 2022

This @Maxar satellite imagery from April 8 shows a large military convoy consisting of hundreds of vehicles that extends for at least 8 miles moving south through the Ukrainian town of Velykyi Burluk (50.060, 37.384). pic.twitter.com/7Qc5ttvi3F ‚Äî Christiaan Triebert (@trbrtc) April 10, 2022
